How It Works Model Your Glue Code domx works by introducing the idea of modeling DOM transformations in a simple state machine on the backend in a JSON configuration object. The state machine is then loaded into the dx-state component which handles all the transformations based on state and exposes its API to the DOM. Click The Stoplight The stoplight is red The stoplight is yellow The stoplight is green Step 1: Wrap markup with the dx-state component and provide the path to the state machine <-- Some styles omitted for brevity --> <dx-state src="/api/stoplight.json"> <dx-row id="stoplight"> <dx-box id="stoplight__red" background-color="red"></dx-box> <dx-box id="stoplight__yellow" background-color="yellow"></dx-box> <dx-box id="stoplight__green" background-color="green"></dx-box> </dx-row> </dx-state> Step 2: Define the state machine { "initialState": "red", "listeners": [["#stoplight", "click", "changeState"]], "actions": { "reset": [ ["attr", "#stoplight__red", "opacity", "0.25"], ["attr", "#stoplight__yellow", "opacity", "0.25"], ["attr", "#stoplight__green", "opacity", "0.25"] ] }, "states": { "red": { "entry": [ ["action", "reset"], ["attr", "#stoplight__red", "opacity", "1"], ["dispatch", "changeState", 2000] ], "changeState": [["state", "yellow"]] }, "yellow": { "entry": [ ["action", "reset"], ["attr", "#stoplight__yellow", "opacity", "1"], ["dispatch", "changeState", 2000] ], "changeState": [["state", "green"]] }, "green": { "entry": [ ["action", "reset"], ["attr", "#stoplight__green", "opacity", "1"], ["dispatch", "changeState", 2000] ], "changeState": [["state", "red"]] } } } Important Note: Most web application code is "glue code" we introduce to keep everything in check. We use a disparate set of libraries to solve such things as manipulating the DOM (ui frameworks) in response to various events and state changes (state management frameworks) an try to keep everything looking good (css frameworks). The dx-state component is not required to use domx but it keeps all that glue code from becoming a sticky mess by solving it in a one simple backend language-agnostic configuration object. This means the backend can control frontend state by reading and reacting to events being emitted from the frontend. Docs for the dx-state component are below.
